page.title: 05Religion in Ditchling
page.content: There are four religious establish_ ments in Ditchling.St.Margaret of Antioch is the Church of England with about 260 on the electoral role.The incumbents have been vicars since the l3th Century.There is a flourishing Sunday School attached to the church, a Women's Fellowship and a Mothers' Union. The Unitarian Church was originally the meeting place of the General Baptists;the '5 Mile Act' debarred them from worshipping within 5 miles of the town.The present minister also officiates at Unitarian Churches in Lewes and Brighton. The Friends Meeting House where the Quakers meet is a building that was originally a slaughterhouse. The Emanuel Chapel houses the Baptists.
